qc.notes: 10/10 required poses present with good focus and neutral indoor lighting.

skin_type.label: combination
skin_type.rationale: T-zone shows more shine and visible pores, while cheeks and jaw appear more matte and even.

skin_tone_fitzpatrick.label: IV
skin_tone_fitzpatrick.note: Estimated from medium-brown appearance across images; lighting and camera white balance limit precision.

skin_age_range.rationale: Minimal lines at rest and good firmness with only mild texture and spot marks.

analysis.overview_explanation: Healthy baseline with moderate cheek marks (post-spot), a fine grain on forehead/cheeks, and T-zone–predominant visible pores. Under-eye darkness is mild and wrinkles are minimal.

pores.rationale_plain: Pores are most visible on the nose and central forehead with some spread to the inner cheeks. Size looks medium and density is clustered rather than diffuse.
possible_causes: Oilier T-zone makes pores more prominent.
Heat, humidity, and pollution can increase congestion and visibility.
Makeup/sunscreen build-up without thorough removal can accentuate pores.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Visibility concentrated on nose and forehead with limited cheek extension.
care_education: Use gentle gel/foam cleansing nightly.
Introduce a leave-on BHA 2–3×/week as tolerated.
Apply broad-spectrum SPF daily to reduce debris oxidation look.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Clustered pores noticeable on nose and medial cheeks.
likely_causes: Oil and debris accumulation in follicles.
Repeated friction such as masks or touching the face.
care_education: Double-cleanse when wearing makeup or heavy sunscreen.
Avoid harsh scrubs; prefer chemical exfoliation.
Blot excess oil instead of over-washing.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Fine grain with a few comedonal bumps near pore-dense zones.
likely_causes: Pollution and sweat film on skin.
care_education: Choose non-comedogenic formulas.
Consider niacinamide to support barrier and refine look.
Patch-test any new actives.

pores.uncertainty_notes: Specular highlights can exaggerate pore visibility.

wrinkles.rationale_plain: Lines at rest are minimal. Only faint, short forehead fine lines are visible on close inspection.
possible_causes: Normal dynamic expression lines.
Intermittent dehydration can accentuate fine lines.
Cumulative UV exposure gradually increases lines over time.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Lines are linked to movement rather than fixed at rest.
care_education: Daily sunscreen to slow photoaging.
Consider gentle retinoid at night for prevention.
Maintain hydration with humectants and emollients.
Layer hydrating serums and moisturizer.
Introduce retinoid gradually if tolerated.

wrinkles.uncertainty_notes: Expression stage was not standardized across all images.

pigmentation.rationale_plain: Cheeks show several small brown marks with moderate contrast, consistent with prior blemish sites. Forehead and nose have lighter, scattered mottling.
possible_causes: Post-inflammatory marks after small breakouts.
High UV exposure common in New Delhi.
Friction/picking can prolong discoloration.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Brown macules correspond to previous spot locations on cheeks.
care_education: Use daily broad-spectrum SPF and reapply outdoors.
Consider gentle brighteners (niacinamide, azelaic acid, vitamin C).
Avoid picking; consult a clinician if marks persist.

identified_subtypes.explanation: A few discrete darker macules on outer cheeks/temple zones.
care_education: Consistent SPF and shade during peak sun.
Use brightening actives as tolerated.

pigmentation.uncertainty_notes: Camera white balance may change perceived contrast.

redness.rationale_plain: Mild, patchy central cheek and nasal redness without strong confluence.
possible_causes: Heat or friction from cleansing/masks.
Transient product reactivity.
Localized dryness increasing visibility of micro-vessels.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Small areas of pinkness on cheeks and around the nose rather than diffuse spread.
care_education: Use lukewarm water and pat dry.
Avoid over-exfoliation; prefer soothing, fragrance-minimal formulas.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Slight tendency for central facial redness.
likely_causes: Environmental triggers such as heat and spicy foods.
care_education: Daily SPF and gentle routine.
Seek clinician advice if burning/stinging or visible vessels persist.

redness.uncertainty_notes: Transient flush is not considered in scoring.

texture.rationale_plain: Forehead and cheeks show a fine grain with tiny bumps; other areas are smooth without flaking.
possible_causes: Dead-skin build-up and micro-comedones.
Pollution/sweat film in warm climate.
Occasional dehydration emphasizing micro-relief.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Numerous tiny, uniform bumps on forehead/cheeks.
care_education: Gentle chemical exfoliation 1–3×/week.
Maintain barrier with humectant + emollient layering.
Avoid abrasive scrubs.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Cheeks slightly rougher than adjacent areas.
care_education: Consistent SPF to prevent marks from persisting.
Consider retinoid at night to gradually smooth.

texture.uncertainty_notes: No tactile assessment; only visible micro-relief cues are used.

acne.rationale_plain: A few comedonal bumps and scattered small inflammatory spots are present mainly on the cheeks; forehead and nose are relatively clear.
possible_causes: Combination skin with oilier T-zone and cheek congestion.
Humidity, sweat, and urban pollution exposure.
Cyclical/hormonal variation and friction/picking.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Small dark-tipped pores on nose/inner cheeks.
care_education: Gentle cleansing and periodic BHA use.
Avoid aggressive extraction methods; patch-test actives.
Hands-off approach to prevent marks.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Tiny closed bumps mainly on cheeks/forehead.
care_education: Introduce a retinoid slowly at night.
Balance with moisturizer to maintain tolerance.

identified_subtypes.explanation: A few small pink bumps on cheeks.
care_education: Spot-treat with leave-on BHA or sulfur.
Seek clinician care if lesions become painful or persistent.

acne.uncertainty_notes: Counts are estimated from still images and can under- or over-represent severity.

under_eye.rationale_plain: Clear but mild under-eye darkening, left slightly deeper than right; no marked puffiness.
possible_causes: Ethnic pigment tendency in Fitzpatrick IV.
Sleep/circulation patterns and rubbing.
UV exposure deepening pigment over time.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Brown-leaning tone concentrated under the eyelids.
care_education: Carry SPF to the eye area perimeter and wear sunglasses.
Gentle brighteners like niacinamide or azelaic acid; avoid rubbing.
Discuss persistent darkness with a clinician if unchanged over months.

identified_subtypes.explanation: Slight tear-trough shadowing, more on the left.
care_education: Hydrating eye products and light-diffusing cosmetics can soften appearance.
In-person assessment required for procedural options.

under_eye.uncertainty_notes: Shadowing varies with angle/lighting; ratings integrate multiple views.

region_summaries.summary_plain: Fine grain and small pores; minimal lines; tone even.
Even tone with low pore and line visibility.
Mild under-eye darkening slightly deeper than right; skin otherwise even.
Mild darkness; smooth texture; minimal lines.
Most visible marks and fine grain; pores decrease laterally.
Similar to left cheek with slightly fewer marks.
Highest pore visibility; mild localized redness near alae.
Even and smooth without notable concerns.
Clear with low pore prominence and smooth texture.
Matches left jaw with low concern visibility.

limitations: Specular highlights may exaggerate pores and texture.
Indoor lighting may alter perceived redness and pigmentation contrast.
No tactile assessment or device colorimetry; findings are RGB-visual only.
